quiz.title: Physics Grade 11: Tension in Systems
quiz.subtitle: Unit 2 Quiz 5: Tension Force Analysis (10 Problems)
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: Two blocks are connected by a light string over a frictionless pulley. Block A (4.0 kg) hangs vertically, and Block B (6.0 kg) rests on a horizontal frictionless surface. What is the tension in the string?
questions.explanation: Let $a$ be acceleration magnitude. For hanging mass: $m_Ag - T = m_A a$. For horizontal mass: $T = m_B a$. Adding: $m_Ag = (m_A + m_B)a \rightarrow a = 3.92$ m/s². Then $T = m_B a = 6.0 \times 3.92 = 23.5$ N.

questions.question: Three boxes are connected by strings on a frictionless table: Box 1 (2.0 kg), Box 2 (3.0 kg), Box 3 (5.0 kg). A force of 40 N is applied to Box 1. What is the tension in the string between Box 2 and Box 3?
questions.explanation: System acceleration $a = F / (m_1 + m_2 + m_3) = 40 / 10.0 = 4.0$ m/s². Tension between boxes 2 & 3 accelerates only box 3: $T_{23} = m_3 a = 5.0 \times 4.0 = 20.0$ N.

questions.question: A 5.0 kg mass hangs vertically from a string in an elevator. What is the tension when the elevator accelerates upward at 2.0 m/s²?
questions.explanation: Upward acceleration: $T - mg = ma \rightarrow T = m(g + a) = 5.0(9.8 + 2.0) = 5.0 \times 11.8 = 59.0$ N.

questions.question: Two masses are connected by a string over a pulley: $m_1 = 8.0$ kg on a 30° frictionless incline, $m_2 = 5.0$ kg hanging vertically. What is the tension in the string?
questions.explanation: Comparing forces: $m_2g = 49.0$ N vs $m_1g\sin30^\circ = 39.2$ N, so $m_2$ falls. Equations: $m_2g - T = m_2 a$, $T - m_1g\sin30^\circ = m_1 a$. Adding: $9.8 = 13a \rightarrow a = 0.754$ m/s². $T = m_2g - m_2a = 49.0 - 3.77 = 45.2$ N.

questions.question: A 10 kg traffic light hangs from two cables: Cable A at 30° with horizontal, Cable B at 45° with horizontal. What is the tension in Cable A?
questions.explanation: Horizontal equilibrium: $T_A \cos30^\circ = T_B \cos45^\circ$. Vertical: $T_A \sin30^\circ + T_B \sin45^\circ = 98$ N. Solving: $T_B = 1.225T_A$, then $0.5T_A + 0.866T_A = 98 \rightarrow T_A = 71.7$ N.

questions.question: Three blocks connected: $m_1 = 2.0$ kg (horizontal, $\mu_k = 0.20$), $m_2 = 3.0$ kg hanging, $m_3 = 4.0$ kg hanging opposite side. What is tension $T_1$ between $m_1$ and $m_2$?
questions.explanation: Acceleration $a = 0.653$ m/s² (from system equations). For $m_1$: $T_1 - f_k = m_1 a$ where $f_k = \mu_k m_1 g = 3.92$ N. So $T_1 = 3.92 + 2.0 \times 0.653 = 5.23$ N.

questions.question: A 15 kg sign hangs from two ropes: Rope 1 horizontal, Rope 2 at 60° with ceiling. What is tension in the horizontal rope?
questions.explanation: Weight = 147 N. From vertical equilibrium of angled rope: $T_2 \sin30^\circ = 147 \rightarrow T_2 = 294$ N. Horizontal equilibrium: $T_1 = T_2 \cos30^\circ = 294 \times 0.8660 = 255$ N.

questions.question: Atwood machine: $m_1 = 6.0$ kg, $m_2 = 4.0$ kg. What is the tension in the string?
questions.explanation: $(m_1 - m_2)g = (m_1 + m_2)a \rightarrow 19.6 = 10a \rightarrow a = 1.96$ m/s². For $m_2$ moving up: $T - m_2g = m_2 a \rightarrow T = 39.2 + 4.0 \times 1.96 = 47.0$ N.

questions.question: A 12 kg crate suspended by three symmetric cables (one vertical, two at 40° from vertical) has equal tension in all cables. What is that tension?
questions.explanation: Weight = 117.6 N. If all tensions equal ($T$): Vertical: $T + 2T\cos40^\circ = 117.6 \rightarrow T(1 + 1.532) = 117.6 \rightarrow 2.532T = 117.6 \rightarrow T = 46.5$ N.

questions.question: Two blocks on inclines connected over pulley: $m_1 = 5.0$ kg on 40° ($\mu_k = 0.25$), $m_2 = 7.0$ kg on 25° ($\mu_k = 0.30$). Which way does system move and what is tension?
questions.explanation: Net driving force favors $m_1$ down incline. Solving system equations gives $a \approx 2.13$ m/s² with $m_1$ moving down. From $m_1$ equation: $T = m_1g\sin40^\circ - \mu_k m_1g\cos40^\circ - m_1a \approx 11.5$ N.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered tension analysis in complex connected systems.
scoreMessages.70: Very good! Solid understanding of pulley systems and equilibrium.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice free-body diagrams and system equations.
scoreMessages.0: Review Newton's laws for connected systems and tension concepts.
